gov.nasa.worldwind.formats.dds

Interface DXTCompressor

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DXT1Compressor, DXT3Compressor

    public interface DXTCompressor
    The DXTCompressor interface will compress an in-memory image using one of the DXT block compression schemes. The details of each block compression scheme is handled by the implementation.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void compressImage(BufferedImage image, DXTCompressionAttributes attributes, ByteBuffer buffer)
      Encodes the specified image image into a compressed DXT codec, and writes the compressed bytes to the specified buffer.
      int getCompressedSize(BufferedImage image, DXTCompressionAttributes attributes)
      Returns the compressed size in bytes of the specified image.
      int getDXTFormat()
      Returns the DXT format constant associated with this compressor.

    • Method Detail

      • getDXTFormat

        int getDXTFormat()
        Returns the DXT format constant associated with this compressor.
        Returns:
        DXT format for this compressor.
        See Also:
        DDSConstants

      • getCompressedSize

        int getCompressedSize(BufferedImage image,
                      DXTCompressionAttributes attributes)
        Returns the compressed size in bytes of the specified image.
        Parameters:
        image - the image to compute the compressed size for.
        attributes - the attributes that may affect the compressed size.
        Returns:
        compressed size in bytes of the specified image.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if either image or attributes is null.

      • compressImage

        void compressImage(BufferedImage image,
                   DXTCompressionAttributes attributes,
                   ByteBuffer buffer)
        Encodes the specified image image into a compressed DXT codec, and writes the compressed bytes to the specified buffer. The buffer should be allocated with enough space to hold the compressed output. The correct size should be computed by calling getCompressedSize(image, attributes).
        Parameters:
        image - the image to compress.
        attributes - the attributes that may affect the compression.
        buffer - the buffer that will receive the compressed output.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if any of image, attributes, or buffer are null.
        See Also:
        getCompressedSize(java.awt.image.BufferedImage, DXTCompressionAttributes)
